<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Satyr](/Monsters.aspx?ID=355)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

To a satyr, life is a party and everyone is invited. Notorious for their hedonism, these fey believe there’s no greater beauty than can be found in song, drink, indulgent meals, and carnal pleasures. Satyrs use their enchanting songs and natural charm to encourage all manner of people to follow their true desires and free themselves from society’s rules. This usually involves enticing mortals to join raucous parties or engage in trysts in moonlit glades. If a potential companion rejects a satyr’s advances, however, the satyr has little interest in continuing a conversation and goes off to find more amenable revelers.

 The lifestyle of a satyr leaves no room for ongoing affairs or long-term friends. Once his party is over or his lust is satiated, the satyr disappears back into the forest. The offspring satyrs leave behind are satyrs themselves, and usually end up being taken from their cradles by other fey rather than being left in mortals’ care. Satyrs are always male.

 The untouched beauty of the forest is sacred and precious to a satyr. Brutish intruders who clear-cut trees or massacre animals without eating them risk drawing a satyr’s ire. A satyr so provoked uses his spells to undermine foes and attempts to dispatch them either with brutal ambushes or by leading a rush of forest animals to attack.

 Other fey, particularly good fey, look upon satyrs as loutish, embarrassing cousins. They’re rarely hostile toward satyrs, but most find them insufferable and advise any mortals they like to steer clear of satyrs’ glades.

<title level="2" right="Creature 4">[Satyr](/Monsters.aspx?ID=355)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="CN" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Fey" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=69" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 284</row>

**Perception** +10; low-light vision

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +8, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +13, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +13, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +11, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +9, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +11, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +8

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +3

**Dex** +4

**Con** +1

**Int** +1

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +5
</row>

**Sylvan Wine** ([enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) A satyr’s wineskin magically enchants any alcohol inside. With an Interact action, a living creature can imbibe the alcohol and gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves and a +3 item bonus to Will saves against fear effects for the following hour. When the wineskin is removed from a satyr’s person, the magic remains only until the wine spoils. The wineskin holds up to eight drafts of wine.

**Items**
[Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3), [Shortbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=77) (20 arrows), [panpipes](/Equipment.aspx?ID=37), [wineskin](/Equipment.aspx?ID=62)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 19 

**Fort** +9 

**Ref** +11 

**Will** +12 

</row>

**HP** 80

**Weaknesses**
cold iron 5

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 35 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+6 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
shortbow +14 ([deadly 1d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 0](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 1d6+3 piercing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
dagger +14 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d4+6 piercing

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 21
- **Cantrips (2nd)**
[Dancing Lights](/Spells.aspx?ID=58), [Ghost Sound](/Spells.aspx?ID=132), [Inspire Competence](/Spells.aspx?ID=385), [Inspire Courage](/Spells.aspx?ID=386), [Triple Time](/Spells.aspx?ID=392)
- **4th**
[Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34), [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [Sleep](/Spells.aspx?ID=288), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315)

**Fleet Performer**   When the satyr Plays the Pipes to cast a spell, he can Step or Stride as part of the activity.

**Play the Pipes** <actions string="Three Actions" /> ([Auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) **Requirements** The satyr is holding a musical instrument. **Effect** The satyr plays a melody on his instrument to cast [_charm_](/Spells.aspx?ID=34), [_fear_](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [_sleep_](/Spells.aspx?ID=288), or [_suggestion_](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) without expending the spell slot and using his music in place of providing the spell’s component actions. The spell gains the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) trait and targets all creatures in a 60-foot emanation instead of its usual targets. A creature that succeeds at its Will save against any spell is then temporarily immune from spells played from that satyr’s pipes for 1 minute. Satyrs are immune to this music.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_5_TreasureAndRewards.png">Satyr Music</title>

A satyr’s gear is valuable, particularly his fine panpipes. Satyrs often stow caches of alcohol, rich food, and pieces of fine art (especially erotic art) in hollows and glades they frequent. Depending on the type of music they prefer to play, satyrs may be able to cast different 4th-level enchantment spells, such as [_paranoia_](/Spells.aspx?ID=214) or [_hideous laughter_](/Spells.aspx?ID=150).
</aside>
